title: Calories in Tuna Salad
meta_description: Learn calories in tuna salad per serving, with full nutrition facts including protein, fat, carbs, sodium, and easy recipe tweaks for lighter options.
assumptions: Prepared with 3 oz canned tuna in water, 1 tbsp full-fat mayonnaise, diced celery, onion, and salt; 1 serving â‰ˆ 1/2 cup or 100g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, tuna type (oil vs. water), mayo brand, added ingredients, and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical 1/2 cup serving of tuna salad provides ~191 kcal and 16 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use light mayonnaise instead of full-fat
Add 1/4 cup chopped celery and apple

faqs.q: How many calories in a serving of tuna salad?
faqs.a: About 191 kcal for a standard 1/2 cup serving with mayo.

faqs.q: Is tuna salad high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, one serving has ~16 g protein from the tuna.

faqs.q: How much fat is in tuna salad?
faqs.a: Around 12 g total fat per serving, mostly from mayonnaise.

faqs.q: Can I make tuna salad lower calorie?
faqs.a: Yes, swap mayo for yogurt or light mayo to cut ~40-50 kcal per serving.

faqs.q: What's the sodium in tuna salad?
faqs.a: Approximately 500 mg per serving, higher if using tuna in brine.
